member.name: P:Mono.Nat.INatDevice.DeviceEndpoint
member.summary: The endpoint to send messages to the WAN device

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.INatDevice.LastSeen
member.summary: The UTC time the last message was received from the WAN device.

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.INatDevice.NatProtocol
member.summary: The NAT protocol supported by the WAN device (e.g. NAT-PMP or uPnP)

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.INatDevice.CreatePortMapAsync(Mono.Nat.Mapping)
member.summary: Creates a port map using the specified Mapping. If that exact mapping cannot be created, a best-effort mapping may be created which uses a different port. The return value is actual created mapping.

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.INatDevice.DeletePortMapAsync(Mono.Nat.Mapping)
member.summary: Deletes a port mapping from the WAN device.

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.INatDevice.GetAllMappingsAsync
member.summary: Retrieves a list of all mappings on the WAN device.

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.INatDevice.GetExternalIPAsync
member.summary: Gets the external IP address associated with the WAN device.

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.INatDevice.GetSpecificMappingAsync(Mono.Nat.Protocol,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the mapping associated with this combination of public port and protocol. Throws a MappingException if there is no mapping matching the criteria.
member.param: The protocol of the mapping
The external/WAN port of the mapping

member.name: E:Mono.Nat.ISearcher.DeviceFound
member.summary: This event is raised whenever a device which supports port mapping is discovered

member.name: E:Mono.Nat.ISearcher.UnknownDeviceFound
member.summary: This event is raised whenever a device which doesn't supports port mapping is discovered.

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.ISearcher.Protocol
member.summary: The port mapping protocol supported by the device

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.ISearcher.Listening
member.summary: While running the searcher constantly listens for UDP broadcasts when new devices come online.

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.ISearcher.BeginSearching
member.summary: Periodically send a multicast UDP message to scan for new devices. If the searcher is not listening, it will begin listening until 'Stop' is invoked.

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.ISearcher.BeginSearching(System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary: Immediately sends a unicast UDP message to this IP address to check for a compatible device. If the searcher is not listening, it will begin listening until 'Stop' is invoked.
member.param: The IP address which should

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.ISearcher.HandleMessageReceived(System.Net.IPAddress,System.Byte[],System.Net.IPEndPoint,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Permits Mono.NAT to process messages not received internally.
member.param: Interface ip.
Response received.
Destination ip.
Cancellation token.

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.Logging.Logger.Factory
member.summary: The factory method used to create new ILogger instances. The parameter is the for the class the ILogger is associated with. You can return for any class to disable logging for that class.

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.Mapping.Description
member.summary: The text description for the port mapping.

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.Mapping.Expiration
member.summary: The time the port mapping should expire at.

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.Mapping.Lifetime
member.summary: The lifetime of the port mapping in seconds. If a lifetime of '0' is specified then the protocol default lifetime is used. uPnP defaults to 'indefinite' whereas NAT-PMP defaults to 7,200 seconds.

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.Mapping.Protocol
member.summary: The protocol used for the port mapping.

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.Mapping.PrivatePort
member.summary: The internal/LAN port which will receive traffic sent to the on the WAN device.

member.name: P:Mono.Nat.Mapping.PublicPort
member.summary: Traffic sent to this external/WAN port is forwarded to the on the LAN device.

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.Mapping.#ctor(Mono.Nat.Protocol,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a port mapping so traffic sent to the on the WAN device is sent to the on the LAN device.
member.param: The protocol used by the port mapping.
The internal/LAN port which will receive traffic sent to the on the WAN device.
Traffic sent to this external/WAN port is forwarded to the on the LAN device.

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.Mapping.#ctor(Mono.Nat.Protocol,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Create a port mapping so traffic sent to the on the WAN device is sent to the on the LAN device.
member.param: The protocol used by the port mapping.
The internal/LAN port which will receive traffic sent to the on the WAN device.
Traffic sent to this public/WAN port is forwarded to the on the LAN device.
The lifetime of the port mapping in seconds. If a lifetime of '0' is specified then the protocol default lifetime is used. uPnP defaults to 'indefinite' whereas NAT-PMP defaults to 7,200 seconds.
The text description for the port mapping.

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.Mapping.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Mappings are considered equal if they have the same PrivatePort, PublicPort and Protocol.
member.param: The other object to compare with

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.Mapping.Equals(Mono.Nat.Mapping)
member.summary: Mappings are considered equal if they have the same PrivatePort, PublicPort and Protocol.
member.param: The other mapping to compare with

member.summary: Sends a single (non-periodic) message to the specified IP address to see if it supports the specified port mapping protocol, and begin listening indefinitely for responses.
member.param: The IP address

member.name: M:Mono.Nat.NatUtility.StartDiscovery(Mono.Nat.NatProtocol[])
member.summary: Periodically send a multicast UDP message to scan for new devices, and begin listening indefinitely for responses.
member.param: The protocols which should be searched for. An empty array will result in all supported protocols being used.

member.summary: Parses a message received elsewhere.
member.param: Type of message.

member.summary: Stop listening for responses to the search messages, and cancel any pending searches.

member.summary: Unexpected failure performing the request.

member.summary: The specified array index is out of bounds

member.summary: The external port cannot be wild-carded.

member.summary: The NAT device supports creating mappings, but the user has turned the feature off.

member.summary: The NAT device itself has not obtained a DHCP lease.
